city.name: Hangzhou
city.lakeDescr: This center is dedicated to the conservation and breeding of giant pandas. You can see pandas in their natural habitat, learn about conservation programs, and support their protection.
city.templeDescr: One of the largest and most important Buddhist temples in China, founded in 328 AD. The temple is famous for its architecture, statues, and picturesque surroundings.
city.plantationDescr: Longjing is a famous area for green tea production. You can visit tea plantations, learn about the tea-making process, and taste fresh tea.
city.quarterDescr: The historic district of Hangzhou, where you can see traditional Chinese houses and streets, and enjoy the ambiance of an ancient city.
city.villageDescr: A village located on the outskirts of Hangzhou, known for its scenic beauty and traditional way of life.
city.ceremonyDescr: In Hangzhou, you can take part in a traditional tea ceremony to learn more about Chinese tea culture and enjoy various types of tea.
